docs.lead_paragraph: The two Minnesota lawmakers cited for allegedly "making out" in a car at a regional park said they paid their fines Friday and would not file a complaint with the Dakota County Sheriff's Office, but stood by their contention that the park ranger's account was wrong.

headline.main: New Health Care Rule Offers Key Protections for Transgender Americans

docs.abstract: The rule would bar insurers and health care providers from discriminating on the basis of gender identity, greatly expanding health care access for transgender people.
docs.snippet: The rule would bar insurers and health care providers from discriminating on the basis of gender identity, greatly expanding health care access for transgender people.

docs.lead_paragraph: A group of religiously affiliated nonprofit organizations in Indiana must comply with the Affordable Care Act's provision allowing their employees to get insurance coverage for contraception, despite their religious objections, a federal appeals court ruled on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration moved to clarify a provision related to federal funds provided under the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Health Care Rules Proposed to Shield Transgender Patients From Bias
headline.print_headline: Health Care Rules Proposed to Shield Transgender Patients From Bias

docs.abstract: Obama administration outlines measure to combat discrimination against transgender patients across health care system; advocates hail proposal which expands definition of sex discrimination in Affordable Care Act to include gender identity; regulation would require many insurers to lift blanket bans on gender reassignment services or risk loss of federal funding.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration moved to clarify a provision related to federal funds provided under the Affordable Care Act.

docs.lead_paragraph: They have begun to organize, airing their displeasure about changes to the industry and contending they are being unfairly demonized.

headline.main: Some Nail Salon Owners in New York Push Back Against Increased Regulation
headline.print_headline: Some Nail Salon Owners Resist New Regulations; ‘We Need Time,’ One Says

docs.abstract: Nail salon owners in New York City are pushing back against crackdown by state officials on the industry, voicing their displeasure with new regulations and requirements; at least 1,000 people from the salon industry participated in strike on Aug 25, sharing information on latest inspections and advocating price increases.
docs.snippet: They have begun to organize, airing their displeasure about changes to the industry and contending they are being unfairly demonized.

byline.contributor: Yuhan Liu and Ileana Najarro contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. government said on Thursday it will extend its healthcare nondiscrimination law to transgender individuals and require health insurers and medical providers to treat all patients equally, regardless of sex.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Government to Extend Healthcare Nondiscrimination Law to Transgender People
